sentence.Network_en: Rarely do schoolteachers have leeway to teach classes the way they want.
sentence.Network_cn: 鲜有学校老师可随心所欲地教书的情况。

sentence.Network_en: How much leeway should parents give their children?
sentence.Network_cn: 父母应该给孩子留多少自由的空间？

sentence.Network_en: It doesn't give you much leeway, does it?
sentence.Network_cn: 这一来,你就没有多少回旋的余地了, 是不是?

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)struggle out of a bad position, especially by recovering lost time
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英)（尤指以挽回失去时间的方法）摆脱困境

entry.tran: 自由；自由空间；回旋余地
entry.def: Leeway is the freedom that someone has to take the action they want to or to change their plans.

example.ex: Rarely do schoolteachers have leeway to teach classes the way they want...
example.tran: 鲜有学校老师可随心所欲地教书的情况。

example.ex: The President said that he wanted to give states more leeway to pursue their own health-care reforms.
example.tran: 总统说他希望给各州更多的医疗改革空间。

entry.tran: （需要弥补的）失去时间，落后差距
entry.def: If you have leeway to make up, you have to work hard because you do not have much time to reach a particular goal.

example.ex: He just could not make up the leeway from the earlier stages in which Ryan scored well.
example.tran: 瑞安在前几轮得分很高，他现在再想赶也赶不上了。

means.word_mean: 1. (of a ship or plane) sideways drift
2. a permissible difference; allowing some freedom to move within limits

auth_sentence.content: Employees have often griped about the lack of leeway.
auth_sentence.res_content: Employees have often griped about the lack of leeway.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Employees have often griped about the lack of leeway.

auth_sentence.content: Court rules give him little leeway to instruct borrowers in court.
auth_sentence.res_content: Court rules give him little leeway to instruct borrowers in court.

auth_sentence.res_content: But they may have had a lot more leeway than we imagined.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But they may have had a lot more leeway than we imagined.

means.word_mean: 灵活性;随意处置的余地

sentences.en: It doesn’t give you much leeway, does it?
sentences.cn: 这一来, 你就没有多少回旋的余地了, 是不是？

sentences.en: He’s got a lot of leeway to make up in his studies after his illness.
sentences.cn: 他病好后要花好多时间赶拉下的功课。

means.word_mean: 摆脱逆境；(尤指)挽回失去的时间

sentences.en: By now, James was so far behind in the race that he knew he had little chance of making up the leeway.
sentences.cn: 此时詹姆斯在赛跑中落后太多，他知道自己已经无力回天。
